title.native: ロックマン エグゼ

description:
In the year of 20XX, a young boy by the name of Netto Hikari receives a very special gift as he enters the 5th grade. His very own customized net navi, Rockman! Despite Rockman's small size and far more responsible personality, the two boys quickly become the best of friends. A net navi is designed to guide his operator from the inside of his or her PErsonal Terminal, or simply PET for short. Children and adults alike enjoy friendly "Net Battles", where they spar their navis against each other to prove their worth.

(Source: Official Site)

name.native: プリンセス・プライド

node.description:
__[Website](http://www.steveblumvoices.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/blumspew) | [Instagram](http://instagram.com/blumspew) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/SteveBlumVoices/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@blumspew) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Voiceactor1/)__

An American voice actor known primarily for his work in anime dubs and video games. Fans of Cartoon Network's Toonami can recognize Blum's voice as TOM, the block's robotic host. He was also the voice of 7-Eleven's "Oh thank heaven" television and radio advertisements.Steven is currently the "disembodied voice"" of the podcast show http://goanimetv.com/ also works with Vic Mignogna making parodies of Budweiser's audio commercials called "real fans of genius".

A veteran of the voice-over business, Steve Blum cut his vocal teeth in the industry, on anime shows like Guyver and Giant Robo, and since has voiced hundreds of diverse characters in productions representing every media imaginable!   Steve's training was highly unorthodox by industry standards. Before voice acting became a full-time profession, Steve worked in a book store, a pet store, an auto-parts store, serviced fire protection equipment, ran a mailroom, drove a delivery truck, managed warehouses, became an international film and video sales/service coordinator, copywriter and marketing executive for a sci-fi film company, an ADR script writer, part-time musician...

But where's the acting experience? All on the job. It started with a few monster growls, then a couple of old men's lines, a hero or two... thousand - and the rest is history. More than 15 years later, he's out there soiling microphones and barking, spitting, and yowling his way into your lives every day and actually making a living at it!

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加戸誉夫)

Currently part of [Studio Mother](https://anilist.co/studio/6638/). Former long-time member of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/), which he joined after graduating from Osaka University of Arts in 1985.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加戸誉夫)

Currently part of [Studio Mother](https://anilist.co/studio/6638/). Former long-time member of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/), which he joined after graduating from Osaka University of Arts in 1985.

[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%BE%BB%E9%99%BD)

You Tsuji is a composer and arranger.

Capcom began in Japan in 1979 as a manufacturer and distributor of electronic game machines. In 1983 Capcom Co., LTD was founded and soon built a reputation for introducing cutting-edge technology and software to the video game market.  Building on its origins as a game machine manufacturer, Capcom is now involved in all areas of the video game industry and has offices in Tokyo, Osaka, California, England, Germany, and Hong Kong.
Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.
Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加戸誉夫)

Currently part of [Studio Mother](https://anilist.co/studio/6638/). Former long-time member of [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/). Originally from [Ashi Productions](https://anilist.co/studio/196/), which he joined after graduating from Osaka University of Arts in 1985.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dinahasegawa)

Hasegawa Keiichi was a secondary writer on Kamen Rider W, Kamen Rider Fourze, Kamen Rider Drive and Kamen Rider Ghost. He is more known for his work on the Ultra Series, having written for every Ultraman series produced since Tiga (except for Ultraman Max), he has written more material for the franchise than any other writer.

He also played a drunken man in Kamen Rider W Returns: Kamen Rider Accel.

(Source: Kamen Rider Wiki)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒川稔久)

Married to fellow scriptwriter [Hiroko Naka](https://anilist.co/staff/181820/).

Began his career at Ashi Productions. Leaving years later with [Nobuyoshi Habara](https://anilist.co/staff/115631/) and other Ashi staff to form [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1995.

During his time at Xebec, Ishihara would become one of the studio's most prolific and trusted animators, supervisors, and designers. He is best known for his adaptive designs for the [Rockman.EXE](https://anilist.co/anime/1710/) series. Other notable character design works include [Bakusou Kyoudai Let's & Go MAX](https://anilist.co/anime/2709/), [Dai-Guard](https://anilist.co/anime/1312/), [Daughters of Mnemosyne](https://anilist.co/anime/3342/), among others.

To this day he is well regarded by former Xebec staff. [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/) recalls how it was Ishihara who had personally recruited him and led to him joining Xebec. [Kiyotaka Oshiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/119806/) said that Ishihara had helped him establish connections at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) early in his career when Ishihara invited him to take part in the first [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/430/) film.
